page.title: 04HISTORIC BUILDINGS,DRAYTON
page.content: { St.Margaret's church Drayton}was built in the late 12th century. The font is believed to be earlier than the church and the lych gate is a much more recent addition.The grave yard boasts a host of rare wild flowers. {St. Edmund's,Taverham}is earlier, having a fine round tower,and is partly thatched,as well as having many recent additions. {St.Edmund's,Costessey}was built in 1300 on a slope,a most unusual feature.Later additions to the church include some 15th century flintwork and a Jacobean pulpit from{Booton. } The original{Drayton Lodge}was built in the early 15th century by the famous{Sir John Fastolf}as a defence against local landowners. It is to be found on the Norwich road, in the grounds of the Nurses' home. { }
